text: Marian Turski (born Moshe Turbowicz; 26 June 1926 – 18 February 2025) was a Polish-Jewish historian, journalist and Holocaust survivor. He was the editor- in-chief of Sztandar Młodych. From 1942 he was in the Łódź Ghetto. His father and brother were murdered after selection. From there, in August 1944, he was deported to German Nazi concentration camp at Auschwitz-Birkenau. He survived forced evacuation of the camp, the Death March of January 1945, from Auschwitz to Wodzisław Śląski, from which he was transported to KL Buchenwald. Turski died in Warsaw, Poland on 18 February 2025, at the age of 98. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Polish journalists Category:Polish Jews Category:Polish historians Category:Writers from Warsaw
